channel.title: NYT > World
channel.copyright: Copyright 2013 The New York Times Company

item.title: Obama, Countering Critics, Defends Iran Nuclear Deal
item.description: President Obama said the agreement with Iran was the result of “clear-eyed, principled diplomacy,” countering critics who called it a capitulation.
item.category: Institute for Science and International Security
item.dc:creator: By SARAH WHEATON and MICHAEL R. GORDON
item.media:description: Secretary of State John Kerry shaking hands with Mohammad Javad Zarif, the Iranian foreign minister, following the announcement.

item.title: Lens Blog: Pictures of the Day: Libya and Elsewhere
item.description: Photos from Libya, Thailand, Ukraine and Indonesia.
item.dc:creator: By THE NEW YORK TIMES

item.title: Syrian Peace Talks to Begin on Jan. 22
item.description: The aim is to create a transitional government based on mutual consent, though the Syrian government and the opposition are still far apart on what that would mean.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE and RICK GLADSTONE

item.title: India Ink: Image of the Day: November 25
item.description: State assembly elections in progress in the central state of Madhya Pradesh.
item.dc:creator: By THE NEW YORK TIMES
item.media:description: Women queuing up outside a polling station in Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh, to cast their votes in the state assembly elections. The results will be announced on Dec. 8.

item.title: Currents: A New Boom Starting Up in Dubai
item.description: Entrepreneurs who stayed in Dubai after the financial crisis, or arrived as others fled, wonder if this kingdom can foster a capitalism from below.
item.dc:creator: By ANAND GIRIDHARADAS
item.media:description: The skyline of Dubai, which is recovering from the global financial crisis.

item.title: Poster Campaign Generates Nazi War-Crime Tips
item.description: The Simon Wiesenthal Center, which runs the campaign, has passed information about four people to the authorities for further investigation.
item.dc:creator: By ALISON SMALE

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Courses Offer Help in Decoding the Third Plenum
item.description: Chinese universities are offering cram courses on deciphering the Communist Party’s recently unveiled Third Plenum reform plan, suggesting that foreigners are not the only ones scratching their heads.
item.dc:creator: By ADAM CENTURY
item.media:description: One change called for by the Third Plenum report is the abolition of the re-education through labor system, this cartoon from Xinhua News Agency explains.

item.title: Oil Prices Dip After Nuclear Deal With Iran
item.description: Easing tensions with Tehran could bring more of its oil and natural gas to global markets, but analysts didn’t see much change in market fundamentals.
item.dc:creator: By STANLEY REED

item.title: Conservative Candidate Leads in Presidential Race in Honduras
item.description: Juan Orlando Hernández had a lead over Xiomara Castro, whose party, Libre, said it would contest the results, setting the stage for unrest.
item.dc:creator: By NICHOLAS PHILLIPS and ELISABETH MALKIN

item.title: In Myanmar, Newly Free Media Struggle to Profit
item.description: Private print publications face competition from state-run dailies and the Internet and are having a hard time finding advertisers and qualified reporters, the editors say.
item.dc:creator: By THOMAS FULLER
item.media:credit: David Hogsholt for The New York Times
item.media:description: The newsroom at the Eleven Media Group in Yangon, Myanmar. The company has a daily and a weekly publication.

item.title: Swiss Voters Decisively Reject a Measure to Put Limits on Executive Pay
item.description: While opinion polls showed widespread dismay about huge executive paychecks, many Swiss were uncomfortable with a rigid, government-imposed salary cap.
item.dc:creator: By JACK EWING

item.title: Government Abuse Drives Eritreans to Flee, U.N. Says
item.description: An investigator said deprivation of freedom and security, and the desire to feel protected, was pushing 2,000 to 3,000 people to leave Eritrea every month.
item.dc:creator: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE

item.title: Obama’s National Security Adviser Meets With Karzai
item.description: The meeting with Susan E. Rice, on a previously unannounced trip, came in the wake of an intensifying confrontation with the United States over a long-term security deal.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.dc:creator: By ROD NORDLAND

item.title: New Egypt Law Effectively Bans Street Protests
item.description: The law is the latest evidence of a return to authoritarianism in the aftermath of the military takeover in July.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK

item.title: Clashes in Eastern Libya Kill Nine
item.description: The fighting followed the deaths of at least 43 people in Tripoli earlier this month and came as rival factions flex their muscles ahead of a bid to elect a constitutional assembly.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK

item.title: India Ink: Couple Convicted of Murdering Teen Daughter and Domestic Help
item.description: The verdict in the trial of the parents of 13-year-old Aarushi Talwar is a turning point in a lurid case that has riveted the nation for the past five years.
item.dc:creator: By MAX BEARAK
item.media:description: Rajesh Talwar, left, father of Aarushi Talwar, heading to a court in Ghaziabad, Uttar Pradesh, on Monday.

item.title: Japan Answers China’s Warnings Over Islands’ Airspace
item.description: Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan called China’s declaration of an air defense zone over a disputed group of islands in the East China Sea an unacceptable effort to change the status quo.
item.dc:creator: By MARTIN FACKLER

item.title: Maoists Are Routed in Nepalese Election
item.description: The first set of results from last week’s vote suggested that the country had swung sharply to the right, and would soon have closer ties with India.
item.dc:creator: By GARDINER HARRIS

item.title: India Ink: Casualties of Kashmir’s Unrest Live in the Dark
item.description: Numerous young men in Kashmir have lost one or both of their eyes after being fired at by the Indian troops and police with pellet guns.
item.dc:creator: By ZAHID RAFIQ

item.title: Bangkok Protesters Raid Finance Ministry Compound
item.description: Crowds also entered the Foreign Ministry grounds, in the latest escalation of a battle between supporters and opponents of former Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra.
item.dc:creator: By THOMAS FULLER

item.title: India Ink: India’s Negotiator Says Climate Treaty Talks ‘Partial Success’
item.description: Ravi Shankar Prasad said the United Nations climate change conference kept the pathway open for a global climate treaty to be finalized in 2015.
item.category: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
item.dc:creator: By BETWA SHARMA
item.media:description: A session in progress at the 19th conference of the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change in Warsaw, Poland, on Friday.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: U.S. Embassy Stocks Up on Air Purifiers
item.description: American officials have ordered thousands of air purifiers for their employees as a way to blunt the hazards and the fears that come with Chinese smog.
item.dc:creator: By EDWARD WONG
item.media:description: A sales manager for Blueair, a Swedish maker of air purifiers, said the United States Embassy had ordered more than a couple thousand but less than 5,000 units.

item.title: Praise in Iran All the Way to the Top, Where Efforts Reportedly Preceded a President
item.description: Iran’s supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, who is said to have allowed secret preliminary talks, called the deal a success and praised the Iranian negotiators.
item.dc:creator: By THOMAS ERDBRINK
item.media:description: Many in Tehran received the news of the deal as though waking from a bad dream. Above, supporters of President Hassan Rouhani of Iran.

item.title: India Ink: The Bard of the Tea Stall
item.description: Laxman Rao of Delhi offers something that most tea sellers, known as chai wallahs, do not – books that he has written and published himself.
item.dc:creator: By ZACH MARKS
item.media:description: Laxman Rao at his tea stand in New Delhi on Nov. 7.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Evacuation Questions After China Pipe Blast
item.description: A deadly explosion in the city of Qingdao came seven hours after initial reports of a leak in a pipeline, prompting some news outlets to ask why a more thorough evacuation had not been carried out.
item.dc:creator: By AUSTIN RAMZY
item.media:description: Workers cleaned up oil after a pipeline leak triggered a deadly explosion in Qingdao, China.
